events.originalText: Lam Wing-kee (pictured), the owner of Causeway Bay Books in Hong Kong, known for publishing political books banned in mainland China, was abducted by Chinese authorities.
events.subtitle: Lam Wing-kee
events.headline: Owner of Causeway Bay Books abducted by Chinese authorities

events.originalText: The inaugural Afro-Asian Games opened in Hyderabad, with 2,040 athletes from 96 nations competing.
events.subtitle: 2003 Afro-Asian Games
events.headline: Inaugural Afro-Asian Games open in Hyderabad

events.originalText: In protest against wage discrepancy and unfair employment practices, 90 percent of Iceland's female population went on strike for a day.
events.subtitle: Gender pay gap
events.headline: 90% of Iceland's female population on strike against wage discrepancy

events.originalText: Three people were killed when falsework collapsed during the construction of the Loddon Bridge in Berkshire, leading to reform of construction practices in the UK.
events.subtitle: Falsework
events.headline: Three killed in Loddon Bridge construction accident in Berkshire

events.originalText: Charges in a military court against generals Dương Văn Đức and Lâm Văn Phát of leading a coup attempt against South Vietnamese leader Nguyễn Khánh, were dropped..
events.subtitle: Dương Văn Đức
events.headline: Charges dropped against generals in South Vietnamese coup attempt

events.originalText: A prototype of the Soviet R-16 intercontinental ballistic missile exploded on the launch pad at the Baikonur Cosmodrome in the Kazakh SSR.
events.subtitle: R-16 (missile)
events.headline: Soviet R-16 missile prototype explodes at Baikonur Cosmodrome

events.originalText: The cornerstone of the United Nations headquarters was laid in New York City.
events.subtitle: Headquarters of the United Nations
events.headline: United Nations headquarters cornerstone laid in New York City

events.originalText: The Charter of the United Nations entered into force after being ratified by the five permanent members of the Security Council and a majority of the other signatories.
events.subtitle: Charter of the United Nations
events.headline: Charter of the United Nations enters into force

events.originalText: World War II: The Japanese battleship Musashi, one of the heaviest and most powerfully armed ever constructed, was sunk by American aircraft during the Battle of Leyte Gulf.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese battleship Musashi sunk during Battle of Leyte Gulf

events.originalText: The George Washington Bridge (pictured), connecting New York City to Fort Lee, New Jersey, and today the world's busiest motor-vehicle bridge, was dedicated.
events.subtitle: George Washington Bridge
events.headline: George Washington Bridge dedicated, now world's busiest

events.originalText: On "Black Thursday", the New York Stock Exchange lost 11 percent of its value at the opening bell on very heavy trading, marking the beginning of the Great Depression.
events.subtitle: Wall Street Crash of 1929
events.headline: New York Stock Exchange loses 11% on 'Black Thursday'

events.originalText: Sir Henry Parkes, Premier of the Colony of New South Wales, gave a speech in which he called for the federation of the six Australian colonies.
events.subtitle: Henry Parkes
events.headline: Sir Henry Parkes calls for federation of Australian colonies

events.originalText: William Lassell found Umbriel and Ariel, the third and fourth Uranian moons to be discovered.
events.subtitle: William Lassell
events.headline: Uranian moons Umbriel and Ariel discovered by William Lassell

events.originalText: War of the First Coalition: The Battle of Schliengen was fought between the French and Austrian armies, who both claimed victory.
events.subtitle: War of the First Coalition
events.headline: Battle of Schliengen fought between French and Austrian armies

events.originalText: As a result of the Third Partition of Poland, the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth ceased to exist as an independent state, with its territory divided between Austria, Prussia, and Russia.
events.subtitle: Partitions of Poland
events.headline: Third Partition of Poland leads to end of Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth

events.originalText: The Brabant Revolution, sometimes considered to be the first expression of Belgian nationalism, began with the invasion of the Austrian Netherlands by an émigré army from the Dutch Republic.
events.subtitle: Brabant Revolution
events.headline: Brabant Revolution begins with invasion of Austrian Netherlands

events.originalText: Qutuz (bust pictured), the sultan of Egypt, was assassinated and replaced by fellow Mamluk leader Baybars.
events.subtitle: Qutuz
events.headline: Sultan of Egypt Qutuz assassinated, replaced by Baybars
